title: Aluminum Price Hits Three-Year High at $2,920/Tonne
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high of $2,920 per tonne due to China's state-imposed production caps creating supply shortages amid rising global demand. The price momentum reflects sustained buying pressure as manufacturing sectors, especially construction and consumer goods, position for recovery.

title: Aluminum price hits three-year high as US-China truce buoys outlook
summary: Aluminum futures on the London Metal Exchange rose to $2,902 a metric ton, reaching the highest level since May 2022. The rally is driven by tightening supply in China due to production caps and an improving demand outlook as trade tensions between the US and China ease, although risks remain from slowing Chinese economic momentum.

title: Aluminum Prices Reach Highest Level Since May 2022
summary: Aluminum futures settled at $2,902 a metric ton on the London Metal Exchange, marking the highest price since May 2022. The price increase is attributed to supply tightening in China and an improved demand outlook amid easing US-China trade tensions, despite ongoing risks such as a slowdown in China's manufacturing sector.

title: Fear of High Prices Intensifies, Secondary Aluminum Trading Turns Sluggish but Cost Support Keeps Prices Firm [SMM Cast Aluminum Alloy Morning Comment]
summary: The most-traded cast aluminum alloy futures contract showed slight price fluctuations with a closing price down 0.33% amid reduced bullish positions. Despite sluggish secondary aluminum trading, cost support factors maintain firm prices, with regional warrant volumes increasing, indicating ongoing market activity and supply considerations.

title: Macro and Fundamentals present mixed signals, SHFE aluminium maintains fluctuating trend
summary: SHFE aluminum futures showed a fluctuating trend with a slight price pullback but maintained an overall upward trend supported by technical indicators. Macro factors include China's central bank liquidity operations and mixed signals from US Federal Reserve officials regarding interest rate cuts, contributing to cautious market sentiment.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices have reached a three-year high driven by surging demand from electric vehicles, solar energy, and grid upgrades. This trend is reshaping supply chains as aluminum becomes increasingly important in the transition to a low-carbon future.

title: Aluminum Price Hits Three-Year High at $2,920/Tonne
summary: Aluminum prices surged to a three-year high of $2,920 per tonne due to China's state-imposed production caps creating supply shortages amid rising global demand. The price momentum reflects sustained buying pressure and supply disruptions caused by strategic production quotas, raw material quality issues, energy costs, and infrastructure bottlenecks.

title: Aluminum Rises Toward 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures approached $2,730 per tonne in October, nearing a three-year high due to expectations of lower supply. China's authorities cut their annual output growth target for base metals, including aluminum, to 1.5% for 2025 and 2026, down from 5%, aligning with a production cap of 45 million tons. Additionally, Alcoa announced the closure of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia due to declining bauxite grades.

title: Fear of High Prices Intensifies, Secondary Aluminum Trading Turns Sluggish but Cost Support Keeps Prices Firm
summary: Secondary aluminum trading has slowed due to fears of high prices, with the most-traded cast aluminum alloy futures contract showing slight declines. Despite reduced bullish positions and weakening technical indicators, cost support has kept prices relatively firm. Inventory data shows regional variations, with some increases in registered warrants across major Chinese regions.

title: Macro and Fundamentals Present Mixed Signals, SHFE Aluminium Maintains Fluctuating Trend
summary: SHFE aluminum prices remain high amid macroeconomic support and tight supply, but demand weakens due to high prices and environmental production restrictions. Inventories in key domestic regions show slight increases, and downstream purchasing remains weak despite active selling from holders. The market sentiment indexes indicate a decline in both selling and purchasing enthusiasm.

title: Colorado's Ball Corp. Weathering Trump's Trade War
summary: Ball Corp., a major aluminum can producer, reported meeting earnings targets despite challenges from increased aluminum tariffs under Trump's trade policies. The company is raising aluminum can prices by 25-30% to offset tariffs and is managing supply chain disruptions, particularly at its Mexico manufacturing plant. The CEO expressed confidence in managing tariff-related uncertainties while sustaining business momentum.

title: Alcoa Targets Net-Zero Aluminum Processing Operations
summary: Alcoa Corporation announced a commitment to reach net-zero emissions in its global aluminum operations by 2050, aiming for a 30% emissions reduction by 2025 and 50% by 2030 compared to 2015 levels. The company is developing innovative technologies such as zero-carbon smelting and mechanical vapor recompression to eliminate greenhouse gas emissions in aluminum production, with carbon-free aluminum already used by companies like Apple and Audi.

title: Fully optimised for sustainability - BMW Group PressClub
summary: BMW Group's light metal foundry in Landshut has been recertified by the Aluminium Stewardship Initiative for sustainable aluminum use, with over one-third of its aluminum sourced from solar power and nearly two-thirds from recycling. This certification highlights BMW's commitment to reducing CO2 emissions and promoting circular economy practices in aluminum production.

title: Alcoa (AA) Soars as Aluminum Prices Hit 17-Month High Amidst Green Energy Boom
summary: Aluminum prices reached a 17-month high driven by strong demand from electric vehicles and renewable energy sectors, boosting Alcoa's market performance. The long-term outlook anticipates a 40% increase in global aluminum demand by 2030, with sustainability and green aluminum production becoming central to industry growth, including investments in carbon-free smelting technologies like ELYSIS.

title: First brake caliper made from 100% recycled aluminium sets a benchmark in sustainability
summary: Brembo introduced the first brake caliper made entirely from recycled aluminum, achieving a 70% reduction in CO2 emissions over the component's lifecycle without compromising performance or design. This innovation marks a significant advancement in sustainable automotive parts manufacturing.

title: The 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit 2025
summary: The upcoming European Green Aluminium Summit in Düsseldorf will focus on aluminum's role in Europe's green transition, addressing green aluminum production, energy transition, recycling, circular economy, and policy. The event will feature discussions on technological innovations, regulatory impacts like the EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism, and sustainability practices, gathering industry leaders and policymakers.

title: China's steel market seen recovering in November
summary: Chinese steel prices are expected to continue their rebound in November, supported by improved market sentiment and positive signals from recent China-U.S. trade talks. Market fundamentals are also projected to strengthen, with prices rebounding from a three-month low in late October.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel prices traded flat at $848/tonne on November 4, 2025, with a 5.87% increase over the past month and a 20.80% rise compared to the same period last year. Forecasts suggest further price increases in the coming months.

title: Steel Prices in the First Week of November 2025
summary: Steel prices for products such as rebar, wire rod, and HR coil are reported for the first week of November 2025, with FOB prices from regions like CIS, Turkey, and Russia listed. The data reflects current global steel market trends.

title: US Steel details plans to invest $11 billion by 2028 across all business segments
summary: U.S. Steel announced a multiyear $11 billion investment plan with Nippon Steel to modernize facilities and expand operations, aiming to unlock significant savings and create jobs. The plan includes upgrades to manufacturing and R&D for lower-emission steel.

title: US Steel details plans to invest $11B by 2028 across all business segments
summary: United States Steel, now under Nippon Steel ownership, has announced an $11 billion investment plan to modernize and expand its operations by 2028, aiming to unlock $2.5 billion in savings from capital investments and $500 million from operational efficiencies. The plan includes over 200 cost-saving initiatives, modernization of key facilities, and a focus on higher-value, lower-emission steel production, with the goal of protecting and creating more than 100,000 jobs nationwide.

title: How Will the $11 Billion Investment Transform U.S. Steel Operations?
summary: The U.S. Steel and Nippon Steel partnership is focusing on integrating advanced Japanese steelmaking technologies, including lean manufacturing, quality control, predictive maintenance, and energy efficiency improvements. The investment aims to diversify product portfolios, enhance manufacturing flexibility, and exceed environmental compliance standards, targeting high-strength automotive, advanced construction, specialty alloy, and aerospace steel production.

title: Union Minister of Steel and Heavy Industries launches the third round of PLI scheme for Specialty Steel
summary: India's Union Minister of Steel and Heavy Industries has launched the third round of the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for Specialty Steel, aiming to attract new investments in advanced steel products like super alloys, CRGO, stainless steel, titanium alloys, and coated steels. The scheme has so far secured commitments of Rs 43,874 crore in investment and is expected to generate significant employment and expand India's high-end steel capacity.

title: Middle East Iron Steel Conference 2025 Dubai Nov 17-19
summary: The conference highlights the MENA region's steel decarbonisation efforts leveraging natural gas infrastructure and renewable energy for hydrogen-based production. Major projects include Emirates Steel's electric Process-Gas Heater pilot and green hydrogen demonstrations, Oman's Vulcan Green Steel Project targeting 85% CO2 reduction, and Algeria's Tosyali DRI capacity expansion with renewable energy partnerships.

title: Scaling Near Zero Emissions Iron and Steel
summary: RMI is accelerating the transition to low-emissions steel production by improving emissions data transparency and supporting hydrogen-based technologies. Efforts include facilitating clean hydrogen infrastructure, publishing decarbonization roadmaps, and enhancing supply chain emissions reporting to help steel producers meet climate commitments.

title: Breakthrough technologies for steel decarbonisation - OECD
summary: The OECD Steel Committee workshop focuses on emerging steel decarbonisation technologies such as Hydrogen-based Direct Reduced Iron, Carbon Capture and Storage, and Iron Ore Electrolysis. The event addresses challenges like infrastructure, cost, and policy support to enable adoption and diffusion of these technologies globally.

title: Iron Ore Quality Decline Challenges Green Steel Ambitions
summary: Declining iron ore quality poses challenges for green steel production as stricter carbon emissions standards increase the cost of impurities. The industry must adopt integrated strategies including selective mining, processing upgrades, and supply chain partnerships to meet premium material demands and sustainability goals.

title: Australian steel supply to protect sovereignty of Hunter Class Frigate Program
summary: Australian steel supply is being secured to support the sovereignty and construction of the Hunter Class Frigate Program, emphasizing local steel production's strategic importance for national defense infrastructure.

title: ESAB x Urban Steel Rockstars 2025 - Making Innovation Possible
summary: ESAB partners with Urban Steel Rockstars for the 2025 convention in Frankfurt, focusing on innovation in steel technology. The event will showcase advancements and foster collaboration in steel manufacturing and sustainability.

title: Comex Copper Settles 2.40% Lower at $4.9260 — Data Talk
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for November delivery dropped 2.40% to $4.9260 per pound, marking a four-day losing streak and the largest four-day decline since August 5, 2025. The price is down 15% from its 52-week high but up 23.58% from its 52-week low, reflecting recent volatility in the copper market.

title: Copper prices fall for 5th consecutive day
summary: Copper prices have declined for five straight days, currently at $10,625 per ton after reaching a record high last week. The drop is attributed to a global market selloff, cautious investor sentiment, and a stronger US dollar putting pressure on metal prices, alongside concerns about US interest rate cuts and stock market uncertainty.

title: Copper prices fall for the fifth day running after hitting a record high last week
summary: Copper prices fell 0.4% to $10,625 a ton in Shanghai trading, down about 5% from the record high of $11,200 reached on October 29, 2025. The decline continues a five-day losing streak amid a stronger dollar and market caution.

title: The Trump Administration Plans Military Action Against Venezuela Overnight; LME Copper Plummets [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME copper prices opened at $10,630.5/mt and closed down 1.57% at $10,649/mt amid geopolitical tensions involving the US and Venezuela. Additionally, Glencore plans to gradually shut down its Horne Smelter in Quebec due to high environmental and operating costs, which may impact copper supply dynamics.

title: Codelco cuts copper output guidance for 2025 despite higher production through September 2025
summary: Codelco, the state-owned copper miner, lowered its copper production guidance for 2025 to between 1.31 million and 1.34 million metric tons, down from previous estimates, despite reporting higher production through September 2025. This adjustment reflects ongoing challenges in the copper market and operational considerations.

title: Ero Copper Reports Third Quarter 2025 Operating and Financial Results
summary: Ero Copper announced a record consolidated copper production of 16,664 tonnes in concentrate for Q3 2025, with a blended C1 cash cost of $2.00 per pound. Production increased quarter-on-quarter at the Tucumã operation by 19%, while Caraíba maintained consistent output.

title: Teck Highlights Progress on Quebrada Blanca Ramp up, Pathway to Full Potential, and Value Delivery to Shareholders from Merger
summary: Teck Resources reported steady progress on the Quebrada Blanca copper project with mill throughput and recoveries meeting expectations. The company is on track to complete key infrastructure by the end of 2025 and aims to transition to steady state operations in 2026. The proposed merger with Anglo American will create a top five global copper producer with combined production expected to reach 1.35 million tonnes by 2027.

title: Codelco cuts copper output guidance for 2025 despite higher production through September
summary: Codelco, the state-owned copper miner, lowered its copper production guidance for 2025 to between 1.31 million and 1.34 million metric tons, down from its previous estimate. This revision comes despite reporting higher production through September 2025.

title: Kinterra Capital Secures US $200 Million in Indicative EXIM Support to Fully Fund Pumpkin Hollow Restart and Advance Southwest Open Pit
summary: Kinterra Capital secured indicative financing of US $200 million from EXIM to fully fund the restart of the Pumpkin Hollow underground copper mine and advance the Southwest open pit. The restart is planned for Q2 2026, aiming to bring approximately 60 million pounds of domestic copper supply online. The project is fully financed, permitted, and debt-free, with ongoing technical and operational preparations.

title: Strategic Energy Resources $400K South Cobar Sale
summary: Strategic Energy Resources completed the sale of its South Cobar asset for $400,000, strengthening its financial position to support future copper exploration and growth initiatives.

title: Mining enough copper to develop the world will require its price to more than double
summary: A University of Michigan study highlights that the copper needed to sustain economic growth and green energy transitions far exceeds current mining levels. The research suggests copper prices must more than double to incentivize new mining projects, with demand scenarios ranging from 1.1 billion to 3 billion metric tons by 2050 depending on energy transition pathways.

title: Rick Rule Copper & Rick Ness Gold Rush Mining Trends
summary: Copper demand is surging in 2025 due to the global transition to clean energy and sustainable infrastructure. Rick Rule emphasizes responsible mining practices aligned with ESG standards, highlighting copper's critical role in electric vehicles, renewable energy, and smart grid technologies, especially in politically stable mining regions like Chile, Peru, and the US.

title: Conducting change: Why copper is key to a renewable future
summary: Copper is essential for renewable energy technologies such as wind, solar, energy storage, and electric vehicles, requiring up to five times more copper than fossil fuel technologies. Despite being 100% recyclable, new copper reserves must be found to meet growing demand, with Australia playing a significant role as a major copper producer.

title: The Copper Initiative: Securing critical copper supply chains for US economic and energy resilience
summary: The Copper Initiative by CSIS focuses on policy solutions to meet future US copper demand critical for national security, economic competitiveness, and energy resilience. It highlights the need for strategic alliances, domestic permitting reforms, and investment incentives to address looming copper shortages essential for defense technologies, AI, and grid modernization.

title: McEwen Copper raises hopes of new technology use in Los Azules study
summary: McEwen Copper's recent study confirms the Los Azules project as a long-life, low-cost producer of high-purity copper cathodes with strong economic returns, raising prospects for applying new technologies in copper extraction and processing.

title: Copper to the World 2025 highlights innovation and global partnerships
summary: The Copper to the World 2025 event showcased emerging technologies such as advanced flowsheets, in-situ recovery, and 3D modelling aimed at reducing environmental impacts and enhancing sustainability in copper mining and processing.

title: McEwen to Acquire 31% Strategic Interest in Paragon Geochemical Leader of PhotonAssay Technology for the Mining Sector
summary: McEwen Mining announced acquiring a 31% strategic interest in Paragon Geochemical, which leads PhotonAssay™ technology—a rapid, accurate, and non-destructive assay method transforming standards for gold, silver, and base metals including copper in the mining sector.

title: Nickel Holds Bearish Momentum
summary: Nickel prices fell to $15,078 per tonne, the lowest since September 2025, continuing a downtrend amid oversupply concerns driven by Indonesia's expanded production. LME stockpiles have risen significantly this year, while demand remains mixed, with weak stainless steel purchasing offset by higher nickel use in electric vehicles.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Nickel prices dropped to $15,029.50 per tonne, down 0.20% from the previous day and 7.25% year-over-year, reflecting persistent bearish sentiment. The market expects prices to remain subdued, with forecasts suggesting further declines over the next year due to ongoing oversupply.

title: LME's nickel price increases by 1.5% on Nov 5
summary: The London Metal Exchange (LME) nickel price rose to around $19,434 per tonne, up 1.53% from the previous day, marking a short-term rebound. This contrasts with broader bearish trends seen in other nickel price benchmarks.

title: Nickel Holds Bearish Momentum
summary: Nickel futures in the UK fell to $15,000 per tonne, trading at the lower end of their narrow range since June due to oversupply, driven by Indonesia's expanded production. Despite a 35% cut in Indonesian mining quotas, soft bidding prices and rising LME stockpiles indicate persistent oversupply, with demand for stainless steel muted but electric vehicle usage rising.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices fell sharply on November 5 once again approaching the 119,000 yuan/mt mark
summary: On November 5, SMM #1 refined nickel prices in China dropped to a range of 119,400–122,500 yuan/mt, with the average down 850 yuan/mt from the previous day. The decline was attributed to a stronger US dollar and internal Fed disagreements, while spot premiums for domestic brands showed mixed trends.

title: Watchdog seeks tighter regulations on nickel mining
summary: Climate Rights International released a report titled 'Broken Promises,' calling for stricter regulations on nickel mining due to environmental and social concerns. The report highlights ongoing issues with mining practices and their impacts on local communities.

title: Canada Nickel and the University of Texas at Austin Launch Carbon Sequestration Pilot at Crawford Nickel Project
summary: Canada Nickel and the University of Texas at Austin launched a one-month in-situ carbon sequestration pilot at the Crawford nickel project near Timmins, Ontario. The pilot injects carbon-enriched water into a 400-metre-deep well to test rapid CO2 mineralization, aiming to support a Zero-Carbon Industrial Cluster vision and inform post-mining carbon sequestration strategies.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French start-up Genomines raised $45 million to scale its innovative approach of extracting nickel using plants (phytoextraction) rather than traditional mining. Their method transforms low-grade land into productive assets, reduces operational costs by up to 50%, and produces nickel concentrates with significantly higher purity than conventional mining outputs.

title: Cobalt-Free Low-Nickel Hydrogen Storage Powder Revolution 2025
summary: A new cobalt-free, low-nickel hydrogen storage powder technology has been developed to reduce costs and environmental impact in battery manufacturing. This innovation uses advanced metallurgical engineering to maintain performance while reducing reliance on cobalt and high-nickel content, addressing supply chain vulnerabilities and price volatility in battery metals.

title: Nickel Industry News, Views and Commentary - Chronickels
summary: The Nickel Institute blog discusses nickel's critical role in sustainability and technology innovation, including its use in EV batteries, thermal solar plants, and corrosion-resistant alloys. It highlights advances such as AI-driven alloy development and addresses concerns about nickel supply for clean energy transitions.

title: Pacific Nickel Mines to sell Kolosori nickel project to Green Rock
summary: Pacific Nickel Mines announced the sale of its Kolosori nickel project, a direct shipping ore nickel laterite project on Isabel Island in the South Pacific. This transaction reflects ongoing strategic shifts in nickel project ownership amid evolving market and sustainability considerations.

title: Italian steelmaker Cogne Acciai Speciali sourcing all energy from renewables
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali is now sourcing all of its power needs in Europe from renewable energy and plans to build a hydroelectric plant and electrolyzer at its main site in Aosta, Italy. The 1-MW electrolyzer will produce green hydrogen powered by renewable energy, expected to be operational by June 2026, supporting the company's goal of zero Scope 2 emissions.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started the pilot phase of producing green hydrogen at its Aosta plant using a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer. The project aims to reduce carbon emissions by powering one of its 70 furnaces entirely with green hydrogen, supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Announces Its Commitment to Sustainability with ResponsibleSteel™ Certification
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has embarked on the ResponsibleSteel™ certification process for its Aosta site, formalizing its commitment to sustainability and responsible steel production. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its strategy to create long-term value for stakeholders and lead the steel industry’s environmental and social transformation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai approves EUR 45 million capital increase for global expansion
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali approved a EUR 45 million capital increase to support the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Pipes and strengthen its global market position. The investment aims to expand operations in aerospace, nuclear, medical, and energy sectors, alongside modernization efforts at its Aosta production facility.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity comes from certified renewable sources. The report reflects the company’s ongoing commitment to sustainability as an integral part of its corporate strategy.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, Italy, as part of its efforts to reduce carbon emissions in steel production. The pilot plant uses electrolysis technology to produce green hydrogen, supporting the company’s sustainability goals.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded the tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of the submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and aims to create an energy bridge between Europe and Africa to enhance energy security. Installation will be carried out by the Prysmian Monna Lisa vessel along the Strait of Sicily.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Italy's Prysmian, the world's largest copper cable maker, views the US copper tariff as an opportunity to strengthen the American supply chain. Following its acquisition of Texas-based Encore Wire, Prysmian is in regular contact with the US administration and expects the tariff to support local business by applying to both semi-finished products and raw metal.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, beating expectations by 3%. Strong growth was driven by Renewable Transmission and Power Grids units, with organic growth of 9.2%. The company maintains a stable high-voltage backlog of about €16 billion, reflecting robust demand in energy infrastructure.

title: Prysmian Q3 2025 slides: Record EBITDA drives upgraded guidance despite stock drop
summary: Prysmian reported its best quarter ever in Q3 2025 with record adjusted EBITDA of €644 million and revenue growth of 9.2%. Despite strong operational performance driven by energy transition infrastructure demand, the stock price fell due to investor concerns about future challenges such as supply chain disruptions.
